title: Strictly Come Dancing's David James reckons judges 'punished him'
text:
David James was eliminated from Strictly over the weekend (Picture: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing’s David James reckons he was marked down by the judges when he began to enjoy his routines.

The former England footballer and his partner Nadiya Bychkova were eliminated from the BBC series at the weekend following a dance-off against Mike Bushell and Katya Jones.

And now the ex-contestant has revealed that he believes that Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse, Alfonso Ribeira and Shirley Ballas ‘punished’ him for letting loose and getting lost in the moment.

‘There was one area with one step that was problematic,’ David admitted. ‘It came out in the live show, and even a little bit in the dance-off.

‘But I loved [the dance]. Through the whole show and the experience, the one thing that has been really challenging is the fact that I was supposed to enjoy it.’

He continued: ‘And when I enjoy it, I make mistakes. And when I make mistakes, I get punished in the scoring.’

David was awarded 16 points for his performance on Saturday (Picture: Guy Levy/BBC)

David was awarded just 16 out of 40 for his jive on Saturday and fumed at presenter Claudia Winkleman when the cameras panned to his mum after he performed.

‘We also have to mention that your mum is in the audience,’ the hostess pointed out during the live show.

However, David didn’t appreciate Claudia drawing attention to his mum and made it clear that she doesn’t like being in the spotlight.

‘Yeah, my mum doesn’t like cameras and she’s on the camera, thanks for that,’ David replied. ‘Hi mum.’

This year’s Strictly is in full swing and it’s each celebrity out for themselves so far, with professionals Aljaz Skorjanec and Janette Manrara admitting they can’t call who’s going to win.

Speaking on Good Morning Britain on Tuesday, Janette said: ‘What I like about this series is we can’t call it. Every week we can’t call who it is that’s going to be in that dance off or what will happen.

‘It’s quite an interesting one because you always kind of see frontrunners and you kind of know what’s going on, but this year literally it’s anyone’s game and I love that.’

Strictly Come Dancing continues on Saturday at 6.35pm on BBC One.
